prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. We will begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Now, we will create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch for this part consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a closed loop (loop\\_1) composed of four lines: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch using the `sketch_scale` parameter of 0.375. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given rotation and translation. In this case, since the euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], no rotation is required. The translation vector is [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.375 units to generate the 3D model. This part has dimensions of approximately 0.375 units in length, 0.375 units in width, and 0.375 units in height. Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom (Joined) The second part is another three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, joined with the first part. We will create a new coordinate system for this part with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.125, 0.375, 0.0] Create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch for this part consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a closed loop (loop\\_1) composed of three lines: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.25] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch using the `sketch_scale` parameter of 0.25. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given rotation and translation. The rotation is specified by the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. Use the rotation matrix to find the rotation matrix and create the 3D sketch. The translation vector is [0.125, 0.375, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.25 units to generate the 3D model. Join this part with the previous part according to the design requirements. This part has dimensions of approximately 0.25 units in length, 0.375 units in width, and 0.25 units in height. Final Shape The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, slightly tapered shape, and dimensions of approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The taper is achieved by the introduction of the second part, which causes the overall shape to be slightly tapered.</description>
